ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Before I entered the military/In the past, I had more close friends than I have now.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I do not feel guilt over things that I did in the military/in the past.
Notes: 5 = Never true; 4 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 2 = Usually true; 1 = Always true

ElementDescription: If someone pushes me too far, I am likely to become violent.
Notes: 1 = Very unlikely; 2 = Unlikely; 3 = Somewhat unlikely; 4 = Very likely; 5 = Extremely likely

ElementDescription: If something happens that reminds me of the military/the past, I become very distressed and upset.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: The people who know me best are afraid of me.
Notes: 1 = Never true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Frequently true; 5 = Very frequently true

ElementDescription: I am able to get emotionally close to others.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Frequently; 1 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I have nightmares of experiences in the military/in my past that really happened.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: When I think of some of the things that I did in the military/in the past, I wish I were dead.
Notes: 1 = Never true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Frequently true; 5 = Very frequently true

ElementDescription: It seems as if I have no feelings.
Notes: 1 = Never true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Frequently true; 5 = Very frequently true

ElementDescription: Lately, I have felt like killing myself.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I fall asleep, stay asleep and awaken only when the alarm goes off.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Frequently; 1 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I wonder why I am still alive when others died in the military/in the past.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: Being in certain situations makes me feel as though I am back in the military/in the past.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: My dreams at night are so real that I waken in a cold sweat and force myself to stay awake.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I feel like I cannot go on.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: I do not laugh or cry at the same things other people do.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I still enjoy doing many things that I used to enjoy.
Notes: 5 = Never true; 4 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 2 = Usually true; 1 = Always true

ElementDescription: Daydreams are very real and frightening.
Notes: 1 = Never true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Frequently true; 5 = Very frequently true

ElementDescription: I have found it easy to keep a job since my separation from the military (civilian version: I have found it easy to keep a job).
Notes: 5 = Not at all true; 4 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 2 = Very true; 1 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I have trouble concentrating on tasks.
Notes: 1 = Never true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Frequently true; 5 = Very frequently true

ElementDescription: I have cried for no good reason.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I enjoy the company of others.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Frequently; 1 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I am frightened by my urges.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I fall asleep easily at night.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Frequently; 1 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: Unexpected noises make me jump.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: No one understands how I feel, not even my family.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I am an easy-going, even-tempered person.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Usually; 1 = Very much so

ElementDescription: I feel there are certain things that I did in the military (civilian version omits mention of the military) that I can never tell anyone, because no one would ever understand.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = True; 5 = Very true

ElementDescription: There have been times when I used alcohol (or other drugs) to help me sleep or to make me forget about things that happened in the past.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I feel comfortable when I am in a crowd.
Notes: 5 = Never; 4 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 2 = Usually; 1 = Always

ElementDescription: I lose my cool and explode over minor everyday things.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: I am afraid to go to sleep at night.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I try to stay away from anything that will remind me of things which happened while I was in the military/in the past.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Almost always

ElementDescription: My memory is as good as it ever was.
Notes: 5 = Not at all true; 4 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 2 = Very true; 1 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: I have a hard time expressing my feelings, even to the people I care about.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: At times I suddenly act or feel as though something that happened in the past were happening all over again.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: I am not able to remember some important things that happened in the past.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: I feel "superalert" or "on guard" much of the time.
Notes: 1 = Not at all true; 2 = Rarely true; 3 = Sometimes true; 4 = Very true; 5 = Almost always true

ElementDescription: If something happens that reminds me of the past, I get so anxious or panicky that my heart pounds hard; I have trouble getting my breath; I sweat, tremble, or shake; or feel dizzy, tingly, or faint.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Frequently; 5 = Very frequently

ElementDescription: Mississippi PTSD Total Score
